sub_releases.notes: This is intended to be taught in a single day. Includes both classroom and a remote version with Nearpod.

sub_releases.summary: Minor update to assets and styling.

sub_releases.notes: Produced by Phuture Doctors, scaffolding student understanding of content
From 1 day into 3 separate class sessions.
sub_releases.acknowledgments: Thanks to Sarah Huneycutt (Nashville, TN) for beta testing this with her class and indicating this needed to be broken up.

sub_releases.summary: Part 3 modified to be more active
sub_releases.notes: For G9-12, students make both histograms; younger students make the female histogram in Part 3.
sub_releases.acknowledgments: Thanks to Lauryn Benedict (Greeley, CO) for making the suggestion that students create (not just interpret) the histogram, and deepen learning.

sub_releases.summary: Major improvements to style and flow
sub_releases.notes: Aesthetics streamlined, graphics, new video showing song counting and other changes.

Debut version of the first official Galactic Polymath lesson. Fully differentiated for G5-6, 7-8, 9-12, also with remote versions. Also added Teach-It-In-15 quickview presentations for all 3 days, and a lesson trailer.
sub_releases.acknowledgments: Thanks to Bonnie Flint (Dallas, TX) for feedback leading to changes to our final lesson format.

sub_releases.summary: Minor fixes to Part 3 & Teach It in 15 presentations
sub_releases.notes: Fixed slides 44-47 in Part 3 remote presentation  more intuitive. Added pink coloring to lesson plan time, grade and subject stats.
sub_releases.acknowledgments: Thanks to Emily Hudson (Nashville, TN) for suggestions.

sub_releases.summary: Added classroom materials and remote fixes
sub_releases.notes: First version with a full complement of in-person classroom versions of presentations and handouts. Fixed problem with Part 3 warm-up. The descriptions of the solution were backwards (i.e. the cipher is -3 encipher, +3 decipher, not the opposite).

sub_releases.summary: Updated Parts 1 & 3 Nearpod versions for all grades, which had links to old videos.

sub_releases.notes: -Changed driving question from "Why has female barn swallow song been ignored or missed by scientists and bird watchers until 2020?" to "What is the best way to visualize data?"

sub_releases.summary: Fixed an issue with remote handout
